item.title: China Cracks Down on Mongols Who Say Their Culture Is Being Snuffed Out
item.description: Authorities are searching for protesters in Inner Mongolia after a new policy aimed at pushing Mandarin-language education across the region sparked widespread unrest among the country’s ethnic Mongols, with many angered by what they saw as a move to erase their culture.

item.title: Covid-19 Pandemic Ravages World's Largest Developing Economies
item.description: From India to Mexico and Brazil, the world’s biggest developing countries are witnessing some of the steepest economic contractions on record, throwing tens of millions out of work and turning back the clock on gains against poverty.

item.title: Lebanese Army Finds Explosive Material Near Beirut Port
item.description: More than four tons of ammonium nitrate was discovered near Beirut’s port, where a larger cache of the same highly explosive material caused last month’s deadly explosion.

item.title: In Novichok Poisoning of Alexei Navalny, Some See a Kremlin Calling Card
item.description: The poisoning of Putin critic Alexei Navalny with Novichok has the hallmarks of the Kremlin—and that may be intentional, some experts say.

item.title: Women's Rights Activists Face Fresh Threat in Egypt After Arrests
item.description: Egyptian security forces have detained witnesses and people who campaigned for prosecuting several accused rapists, fueling fears of further raids and arrests among women’s rights activists in the country.

item.title: France Reveals $118 Billion Plan to Relaunch Economy
item.description: France detailed a plan Thursday to inject $118 billion into its economy, which has taken an outsize beating from the coronavirus pandemic.
